name: mumps

conflicts.name: +parmetis
conflicts.description: You cannot use the parmetis variant without mpi

conflicts.name: +parmetis
conflicts.description: You cannot use the parmetis variant without metis

conflicts.name: +ptscotch
conflicts.description: You cannot use the ptscotch variant without mpi

conflicts.name: +blr_mt
conflicts.description: You cannot use the blr_mt variant without openmp

variants.name: scotch
variants.description: Activate Scotch as a possible ordering library

variants.name: ptscotch
variants.description: Activate PT-Scotch as a possible ordering library

variants.name: metis
variants.description: Activate Metis as a possible ordering library

variants.name: parmetis
variants.description: Activate Parmetis as a possible ordering library

variants.name: complex
variants.description: Activate the compilation of cmumps and/or zmumps

variants.name: int64
variants.description: Use int64_t/integer*8 as default index type

variants.name: incfort
variants.description: Use explicit types size in fortran headers

variants.name: blr_mt
variants.description: Allow BLAS calls in OpenMP regions (warning: might not be supported by all multithread BLAS)

description: MUMPS: a MUltifrontal Massively Parallel sparse direct Solver

dependencies.name: scotch
dependencies.description:
Scotch is a software package for graph and mesh/hypergraph partitioning,
graph clustering, and sparse matrix ordering.

dependencies.name: metis
dependencies.description:
METIS is a set of serial programs for partitioning graphs, partitioning
finite element meshes, and producing fill reducing orderings for sparse
matrices. The algorithms implemented in METIS are based on the
multilevel recursive-bisection, multilevel k-way, and multi-constraint
partitioning schemes.

dependencies.name: parmetis
dependencies.description:
ParMETIS is an MPI-based parallel library that implements a variety of
algorithms for partitioning unstructured graphs, meshes, and for
computing fill-reducing orderings of sparse matrices.

dependencies.name: scalapack
dependencies.description:
ScaLAPACK is a library of high-performance linear algebra routines for
parallel distributed memory machines. It depends on external libraries
including BLAS and LAPACK for Linear Algebra computations. AMD's
optimized version of ScaLAPACK enables using BLIS and LibFLAME library
that have optimized dense matrix functions and solvers for AMD EPYC
processor family CPUs.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
MPItrampoline: A forwarding MPI implementation that can use any other
MPI implementation via an MPI ABI.

dependent_to.name: py-pymumps
dependent_to.description: Python bindings for MUMPS, a parallel sparse direct solver

dependent_to.name: petsc
dependent_to.description:
PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable
(parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial
differential equations.

dependent_to.name: elmerfem
dependent_to.description:
Elmer is an open source multiphysical simulation software. It includes
physical models of fluid dynamics, structural mechanics,
electromagnetics, heat transfer and acoustics.

dependent_to.name: fujitsu-frontistr
dependent_to.description: This is a fork repository of the FrontISTR tuned for A64FX.

dependent_to.name: py-sfepy
dependent_to.description:
SfePy (https://sfepy.org/) is a software for solving systems of coupled
partial differential equations (PDEs) by the finite element method in
1D, 2D and 3D. It can be viewed both as black-box PDE solver, and as a
Python package which can be used for building custom applications.

dependent_to.name: ipopt
dependent_to.description:
Ipopt (Interior Point OPTimizer, pronounced eye-pea-Opt) is a software
package for large-scale nonlinear optimization.

dependent_to.name: zpares
dependent_to.description:
z-Pares is designed to compute a few eigenvalues and eigenvectors of
sparse matrices.

dependent_to.name: akantu
dependent_to.description:
Akantu means a little element in Kinyarwanda, a Bantu language. From
now on it is also an opensource object-oriented Finite Element library
which has the ambition to be generic and efficient.

dependent_to.name: trilinos
dependent_to.description:
The Trilinos Project is an effort to develop algorithms and enabling
technologies within an object-oriented software framework for the
solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and
scientific problems. A unique design feature of Trilinos is its focus on
packages.

dependent_to.name: hpddm
dependent_to.description: High-performance unified framework for domain decomposition methods.

dependent_to.name: frontistr
dependent_to.description:
Open-Source Large-Scale Parallel FEM Program for Nonlinear Structural
Analysis
